text.div:
• Include these codes as defined in http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/who-smart-hiv-dak/CodeSystem/concept-codes
    CodeDisplayDefinition
    HIV.D.DE290AsymptomaticWHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - Asymptomatic
    HIV.D.DE291Persistent generalized lymphadenopathyWHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - Persistent generalized lymphadenopathy
    HIV.D.DE292Moderate unexplained weight lossWHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - Moderate unexplained weight loss
    HIV.D.DE293Recurrent respiratory tract infectionsWHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - Recurrent respiratory tract infections
    HIV.D.DE294Unexplained persistent hepatosplenomegalyWHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - Unexplained persistent hepatosplenomegaly
    HIV.D.DE295Herpes zosterWHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - Herpes zoster
    HIV.D.DE296Angular cheilitisWHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - Angular cheilitis
    HIV.D.DE297Linear gingival erythemaWHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - Linear gingival erythema
    HIV.D.DE298Recurrent oral ulcerationWHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - Recurrent oral ulceration
    HIV.D.DE299Papular pruritic eruptionWHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - Papular pruritic eruption
    HIV.D.DE300Fungal nail infectionsWHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - Fungal nail infections
    HIV.D.DE301Seborrhoeic dermatitisWHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - Seborrhoeic dermatitis
    HIV.D.DE302Extensive wart virus infectionWHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - Extensive wart virus infection
    HIV.D.DE303Extensive molluscum contagiosumWHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - Extensive molluscum contagiosum
    HIV.D.DE304Unexplained persistent parotid enlargementWHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - Unexplained persistent parotid enlargement
    HIV.D.DE305Unexplained severe weight loss in adultsWHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - Unexplained severe weight loss in adults
    HIV.D.DE306Unexplained moderate malnutrition not adequately responding to standard therapyWHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - Unexplained moderate malnutrition not adequately responding to standard therapy
    HIV.D.DE307Unexplained chronic diarrhoea for longer than 1 monthWHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - Unexplained chronic diarrhoea for longer than 1 month
    HIV.D.DE308Unexplained persistent diarrhoea (14 days or more)WHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - Unexplained persistent diarrhoea (14 days or more)
    HIV.D.DE309Unexplained persistent fever (above 37.5 C, intermittent or constant, for longer than one 1 month)WHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - Unexplained persistent fever (above 37.5 C, intermittent or constant, for longer than one 1 month)
    HIV.D.DE310Persistent oral candidiasisWHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - Persistent oral candidiasis
    HIV.D.DE311Oral hairy leukoplakiaWHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - Oral hairy leukoplakia
    HIV.D.DE312Pulmonary TBWHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - Pulmonary TB
    HIV.D.DE313Lymph node TBWHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - Lymph node TB
    HIV.D.DE314Severe bacterial infections (such as pneumonia, empyema, pyomyositis, bone or joint infection, meningitis, bacteraemia)WHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - Severe bacterial infections (such as pneumonia, empyema, pyomyositis, bone or joint infection, meningitis, bacteraemia)
    HIV.D.DE315Severe recurrent bacterial pneumoniaWHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - Severe recurrent bacterial pneumonia
    HIV.D.DE316Acute necrotizing ulcerative stomatitisWHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - Acute necrotizing ulcerative stomatitis
    HIV.D.DE317Acute necrotizing ulcerative gingivitisWHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - Acute necrotizing ulcerative gingivitis
    HIV.D.DE318Acute necrotizing ulcerative periodontitisWHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - Acute necrotizing ulcerative periodontitis
    HIV.D.DE319Unexplained anaemia (<8 g/dL)WHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - Unexplained anaemia (<8 g/dL)
    HIV.D.DE320Neutropaenia (<0.5 x 10^9/L)WHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - Neutropaenia (<0.5 x 10^9/L)
    HIV.D.DE321Chronic thrombocytopaenia (<50 x 10^9/L)WHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - Chronic thrombocytopaenia (<50 x 10^9/L)
    HIV.D.DE322Symptomatic lymphoid interstitial pneumonitisWHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - Symptomatic lymphoid interstitial pneumonitis
    HIV.D.DE323Chronic HIV-associated lung disease, including bronchiectasisWHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - Chronic HIV-associated lung disease, including bronchiectasis
    HIV.D.DE324HIV wasting syndromeWHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - HIV wasting syndrome
    HIV.D.DE325Unexplained severe wasting not responding to standard therapyWHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - Unexplained severe wasting not responding to standard therapy
    HIV.D.DE326Unexplained stunting not responding to standard therapyWHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - Unexplained stunting not responding to standard therapy
    HIV.D.DE327Unexplained severe malnutrition not responding to standard therapyWHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - Unexplained severe malnutrition not responding to standard therapy
    HIV.D.DE328Pneumocystis (jirovecii) pneumoniaWHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - Pneumocystis (jirovecii) pneumonia
    HIV.D.DE329Recurrent severe bacterial pneumoniaWHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - Recurrent severe bacterial pneumonia
    HIV.D.DE330Recurrent severe bacterial infections (such as empyema, pyomyositis, bone or joint infection, meningitis, but excluding pneumonia)WHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - Recurrent severe bacterial infections (such as empyema, pyomyositis, bone or joint infection, meningitis, but excluding pneumonia)
    HIV.D.DE331EmpyemaWHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - Empyema
    HIV.D.DE332PyomyositisWHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - Pyomyositis
    HIV.D.DE333Bone or joint infectionWHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - Bone or joint infection
    HIV.D.DE334MeningitisWHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - Meningitis
    HIV.D.DE335Chronic herpes simplex infection (orolabial or cutaneous of more than 1 month duration or visceral at any site)WHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - Chronic herpes simplex infection (orolabial or cutaneous of more than 1 month duration or visceral at any site)
    HIV.D.DE336Chronic herpes simplex infection (orolabial, genital or anorectal of more than 1 month in duration or visceral at any site)WHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - Chronic herpes simplex infection (orolabial, genital or anorectal of more than 1 month in duration or visceral at any site)
    HIV.D.DE337Oesophageal candidiasis (or candidiasis of trachea, bronchi or lungs)WHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - Oesophageal candidiasis (or candidiasis of trachea, bronchi or lungs)
    HIV.D.DE338Extrapulmonary TBWHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - Extrapulmonary TB
    HIV.D.DE339Kaposi sarcomaWHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - Kaposi sarcoma
    HIV.D.DE340Cytomegalovirus infection (retinitis or infection of other organs)WHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - Cytomegalovirus infection (retinitis or infection of other organs)
    HIV.D.DE341Central nervous system toxoplasmosisWHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - Central nervous system toxoplasmosis
    HIV.D.DE342HIV encephalopathyWHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - HIV encephalopathy
    HIV.D.DE343Extrapulmonary cryptococcosis, including meningitisWHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - Extrapulmonary cryptococcosis, including meningitis
    HIV.D.DE344Disseminated nontuberculous mycobacterial infectionWHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - Disseminated nontuberculous mycobacterial infection
    HIV.D.DE345Progressive multifocal leukoencephalopathyWHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - Progressive multifocal leukoencephalopathy
    HIV.D.DE346Chronic cryptosporidiosisWHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - Chronic cryptosporidiosis
    HIV.D.DE347Chronic cryptosporidiosis (with diarrhoea)WHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - Chronic cryptosporidiosis (with diarrhoea)
    HIV.D.DE348Chronic isosporiasisWHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - Chronic isosporiasis
    HIV.D.DE349Disseminated mycosis (extrapulmonary histoplasmosis, coccidioidomycosis)WHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - Disseminated mycosis (extrapulmonary histoplasmosis, coccidioidomycosis)
    HIV.D.DE350Disseminated endemic mycosis (extrapulmonary histoplasmosis, coccidioidomycosis, penicilliosis)WHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - Disseminated endemic mycosis (extrapulmonary histoplasmosis, coccidioidomycosis, penicilliosis)
    HIV.D.DE351Cerebral lymphomaWHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - Cerebral lymphoma
    HIV.D.DE352B-cell non-Hodgkin lymphomaWHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - B-cell non-Hodgkin lymphoma
    HIV.D.DE353HIV-associated nephropathy or cardiomyopathyWHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - HIV-associated nephropathy or cardiomyopathy
    HIV.D.DE354Recurrent septicaemia (including nontyphoidal Salmonella)WHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - Recurrent septicaemia (including nontyphoidal Salmonella)
    HIV.D.DE355Invasive cervical carcinomaWHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - Invasive cervical carcinoma
    HIV.D.DE356Atypical disseminated leishmaniasisWHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - Atypical disseminated leishmaniasis
    HIV.D.DE357NeutropeniaWHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - Neutropenia
    HIV.D.DE935Pulmonary TBWHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - Pulmonary TB
    HIV.D.DE936Lymph node TBWHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - Lymph node TB
    HIV.D.DE937Extrapulmonary TBWHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom - Extrapulmonary TB

name: WHOHIVclinicalstageconditionorsymptomCodes
title: WHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom Codes
description: Codes representing possible values for the WHO HIV clinical stage condition or symptom element

concept.display: Unexplained severe weight loss in adults
Unexplained moderate malnutrition not adequately responding to standard therapy
Unexplained chronic diarrhoea for longer than 1 month
Unexplained persistent diarrhoea (14 days or more)
Unexplained persistent fever (above 37.5 C, intermittent or constant, for longer than one 1 month)
Severe bacterial infections (such as pneumonia, empyema, pyomyositis, bone or joint infection, meningitis, bacteraemia)
Chronic HIV-associated lung disease, including bronchiectasis
Unexplained severe wasting not responding to standard therapy
Unexplained stunting not responding to standard therapy
Unexplained severe malnutrition not responding to standard therapy
Recurrent severe bacterial infections (such as empyema, pyomyositis, bone or joint infection, meningitis, but excluding pneumonia)
Chronic herpes simplex infection (orolabial or cutaneous of more than 1 month duration or visceral at any site)
Chronic herpes simplex infection (orolabial, genital or anorectal of more than 1 month in duration or visceral at any site)
Oesophageal candidiasis (or candidiasis of trachea, bronchi or lungs)
Cytomegalovirus infection (retinitis or infection of other organs)
Disseminated endemic mycosis (extrapulmonary histoplasmosis, coccidioidomycosis, penicilliosis)
